sceneDescription.title: Rome's Moral Emptiness Under Nero's Reign

setting.time: 64 AD, midday, extreme summer heat wave
setting.location: Forum Romanum, usually busy public square now nearly deserted
setting.weather: Brutal heat with no shade, air shimmering with heat waves

characters.appearance: Lone moral voice, elderly Roman senator in his sixties, noble face showing disgust at imperial decadence
characters.clothing: Traditional senatorial toga with purple stripe, gold senatorial ring, dignified bearing despite surroundings
characters.position: Standing alone in forum abandoned by decent citizens
characters.action: Witnessing empire's moral decay, holding scroll of complaints against Nero's tyranny, last voice of Roman virtue

scene.mainElements: Vast empty marble plaza that would normally be crowded, all shadows occupied by people and animals seeking relief, heat distortion making air visible
scene.details: Marble pavement stained with blood from executions, moral corruption creating spiritual distortion, bronze statues witnessing unspeakable acts, fountains running red with martyrs' blood, not a single decent citizen remaining in public, even temple priests hiding in shame, dust of empire's decay hanging in air
scene.background: Temple steps crowded with people pressed against shaded walls, basilica porticoes packed with heat refugees, distant hills wavering in heat distortion
scene.atmosphere: Oppressive tyranny making moral life impossible, desperation for any remnant of virtue or justice, air itself poisoned by evil, survival behavior in extreme moral climate where decency means death

composition.cameraAngle: Wide shot showing vast empty forum with single running figure
composition.focus: Lone messenger crossing blazing empty space toward distant shade
composition.depth: Foreground glaring marble with heat distortion, middle ground running figure, background crowded shaded areas and heat-hazed buildings
